DataElement.preferredName: FSFI 5 Past 4 Weeks Confidence Becoming Sexually Aroused During Sexual Activity or Intercourse Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how confident in the past 4 weeks they were about becoming sexually aroused during sexual activity or intercourse, using a 6 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Female Sexual Function Index Past 4 Weeks Confidence of Becoming Sexually Aroused During Sexual Activity or Intercourse Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 19-item self-report questionnaire designed to measure sexual function in women. It was developed for assessing domains of sexual functioning (e.g. sexual arousal, orgasm, satisfaction, pain) in women participating in clinical trials for arousal disorders._A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present._A question about how confident an individual is or was to become sexually aroused during sexual activity or intercourse._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 19-item self-report questionnaire designed to measure sexual function in women. It was developed for assessing domains of sexual functioning (e.g. sexual arousal, orgasm, satisfaction, pain) in women participating in clinical trials for arousal disorders.

Concepts.definition: A 19-item self-report questionnaire designed to measure sexual function in women. It was developed for assessing domains of sexual functioning (e.g. sexual arousal, orgasm, satisfaction, pain) in women participating in clinical trials for arousal disorders.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present.

Concepts.longName: Confidence of Becoming Sexually Aroused During Sexual Activity or Intercourse
Concepts.definition: A question about how confident an individual is or was to become sexually aroused during sexual activity or intercourse.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Female Sexuality Function Index Confidence Level 6 Point Scale

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating the absence of sexual activity.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating the absence of sexual activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating a very low level of confidence or an absence.

Concepts.longName: Very Low Confidence or No Confidence
Concepts.definition: A response indicating a very low level of confidence or an absence.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating a low level of confidence.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating a low level of confidence.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating a moderate level of confidence.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating a moderate level of confidence.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating a high level of confidence.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating a high level of confidence.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating a very high level of confidence.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating a very high level of confidence.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Over the past 4 weeks, how co
ReferenceDocuments.description: Over the past 4 weeks, how confident were you about becoming sexually aroused during sexual activity or intercourse?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.
